== Main Inclusion Report for pam-keyring ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/p/pam-keyring/ ; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Ease the life of the user at loggin by avoiding him to entering his password several times for applications using gnome-keyring
** Direct connection to protected wifi using network-manager at loggin
 0. ''Security:''
** No <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=pam-keyring|CVE entries]]</nowiki>.
** No <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=pam-keyring|Secunia history]]</nowiki>.
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.
** Does not open any port.
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Adding include to relevant pam services needed in order to use this package
** No <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:pam-keyring|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/p/pam-keyring.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki>: How to describe myself :) , not a DD
** Active <nowiki>[[http://www.hekanetworks.com/pam_keyring/|Upstream]]</nowiki>: little bit overworked ATM
** No <nowiki>[[http://|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki> found
** Does not deal with exotic hardware which we cannot support.
 0. ''Standards compliance:''
** Meets <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki>
** Meets <nowiki>[[http://www.netfort.gr.jp/~dancer/column/libpkg-guide/libpkg-guide.html|Debian library packaging guide]]</nowiki> standards
** Standard debhelper packaging, standard patch system.
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** All in Main
